>
> But the user *does* have to type credentials over and over.  Fortunately,
> the browser is doing the work for him.  Why would a RESTful application
care
> whether the user was "logged in" or "logged out"?  All the server should
> care about is that the user is authorized.
>

If the browser is doing the work, then the use isn't typing username and
password for each page accessed in the realm.  That's like a "session"
between user (person) and UI (browser), which is different from a session
between UI and server, which is frowned upon in REST, for scaleability
reasons.

Above, I think you're talking about UI-server stuff; I'm not.

Walden
